titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: James Whitaker was a Chief Engineer in the US Navy.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of James Whitaker. Materials include: papers related to the invention of an underwater gun-port, including descriptions, correspondence, clippings, and a photograph of a prototype; a copy of Naval Engineers Regulations for USS Pembina; letters and other papers related to Whitaker's naval service; and papers on William H. Shock related to his being recommended for the position of Engineer in Chief, 1873. The collection also includes cartes de visites of naval officers, many labeled on the reverse with names, vessels, and location; and a group photograph taken at Valparaiso, Chile, 1869.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
